results.title: Good mothers
results.creator_credit: Mogens Skot Hansen, Nordisk Films Kompagni and Carl Theodor Dreyer
results.brief_description: Using unconventional directional and editing devices, this production provides an insight into Denmark’s progressive laws and social structures that protect mothers and their children. Shows how married and unmarried mothers in Denmark are provided with assistance through the nation-wide system of ‘Mother’s Aid Institution’. Describes in dramatised form the story of an unmarried mother. Free assistance includes pre-natal attention and classes in the care of children. Following the birth of her child in hospital in Copenhagen the mother spends some time at a Mother’s Aid home, where she receives instruction in homecrafts and is trained to earn a living. Also reveals that since 1888, fathers have been required by Danish law to financially support their children until the age of 18. Commentary by Dinah Miller.

results.title: Good morning, Beijing = Beijing ni zao [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Youth Film Studio, Beijing Film Academy and Zhang Nuanxin
results.brief_description: Directed by one of the few women to have become prominent in China’s film industry, this film depicts the head-on collision between socialist and market ethics in 1980s Beijing through the work and romantic lives of a group of young adults. The equilibrium between three friends who work as bus conductors is disturbed as they seize upon new challenges and opportunities that open up to them as a result of economic reforms. Cast includes Ma Xiaoqing and Wang Quan’an. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Good Monday morning (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the impact of new technology on women office workers. It presents various personal perspective’s on the working life and illustrates a cross-section of contemporary conditions.

results.title: Good lighting. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Peter Combes and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Shows how the balance of studio lighting is controlled by the faders on a lighting console. The problems arising from a high or a low overall light level are explained and the use of the lens iris is discussed. The limited contrast range needed for a television camera is demonstrated. Presented by Bob Holness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Combes and Centre for Educational Television Overseas

results.title: Good lighting. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Peter Combes and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Continues the discussion of lighting commenced in Part 1. Unwanted shadows are demonstrated and the difference between a “hard” and “soft” shadow explained. The elimination of such shadows is shown. The three light arrangement is extended to four, and the “modified three light arrangement”. The latter is extended to cover a large studio area. Also covers lighting of the discussion set. Presented by Bob Holness.

results.title: Good lighting. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Centre for Educational Television Overseas and Gordon Severn
results.brief_description: The first of three films on the techniques of television lighting. The principles of showing the modelling of a subject by means of light and shade are discussed as an introduction to studio lighting. The basic three light arrangement is shown in detail. Different ways of lighting the background are also shown. Presented by Bob Holness.

results.title: Good housekeeping: for men only
results.brief_description: A safety film for employees in the building industry. Shows how to increase efficiency and reduce accidents by proper use and storage of materials and by taking proper precautions in the course of the building activities.

results.title: Good Housekeeping
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
A strictly maintained and controlled good housekeeping policy is an essential part of any safety plan. It achieves a reduction in slips, trips, and falls type accidents, eliminates many potential fire hazards and makes for a generally more pleasant work environment.

results.title: Good health: talking feet
results.creator_credit: Philip Grosset, ATV Colour Productions and Albert Wallace
results.brief_description: Presents information on foot care and correct shoe fitting. Indicates problems caused by poorly fitted shoes, and the types of remedies appropriate to corns, tinea and warts.

results.title: Good fences
results.creator_credit: Southern Films, Cyclone and Barry Scott
results.brief_description: It is a sound investment to have strong, well made fences. This film demonstrates how good fences are made and shows some of the different types of wire used - box wire, wire netting and barbed wire.
